instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video, no mouse light
threads.message:
This board was liquide damaged. Was cleaned already with US
Now it power and work ok only if CPU is hot. First time I turn it on it power and I have CPU core, CPU warm but no mouse and no video. If I have it 2 minutes working and then remove power and turn it again it will work now. I can turn it on and off many times and it will work every time. Only if I wait 10-15 minutes and board became cold it will not power anymore with video but CPU core is present always. Already checked bios area and seems ok.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video, no mouse light
threads.message: Corrosion somewhere....U/S will not remove corrosion under SMC etc.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video, no mouse light
threads.message: I did a mini reflow to all rams, smc and cpu-pch but I forgot to say in my first post. Do you recommend to reball SMC?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video, no mouse light
threads.message: It could be anywhere where the corrosion was. No way to tell what is going on with this board. I more suspect a corroded trace or resistor.
